page.title: 03Religion in West Ashby.
page.content: The church of All Saints, said to date back to the 13th century, but thought to have been built in the reign of Henry V11, must surely have been used since that time for religious worship. But erected in 1878 at a cost of Â£1000, the Wesleyan Chapel held a strong position for many years. It was positioned on a high bank. John Wesley preached in the village, having been at Oxford University with the son of the owner of West Ashby at that time - the Panton heiress. Services were discontinued in 1973 and the building demolished in 1977, some of the bricks being used in the reconstruction of Louth Methodist Church, and a bungalow has been built on the site. There was also a Chapel for Primitive Methodists.
